DataElement.preferredName: Agent Post Registration Bupropion Administered Month Duration
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the number of months between registration and administration of Bupropion, an aminoketone with antidepressant activity, following officially enrolling on a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to administration of Bupropion, an aminoketone with antidepressant activity, following officially enrolling on a clinical trial.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.

ObjectClass.changeDescription: Updated to add EVS Concept code - dw

Property.preferredDefinition: Post; occuring after.:The act of listing or recording officially; officially qualified or enrolled.:An aminoketone with antidepressant activity. The molecular mechanism of the antidepressant effect of bupropion is unknown.  This agent does not inhibit monoamine oxidase and, compared to classical tricyclic antidepressants, is a weak blocker of the neuronal uptake of serotonin and norepinephrine. Buproprion also weakly inhibits the neuronal re-uptake of dopamine.:Given.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
The act of listing or recording officially; officially qualified or enrolled.

An aminoketone with antidepressant activity. The molecular mechanism of the antidepressant effect of bupropion is unknown.  This agent does not inhibit monoamine oxidase and, compared to classical tricyclic antidepressants, is a weak blocker of the neuronal uptake of serotonin and norepinephrine. Buproprion also weakly inhibits the neuronal re-uptake of dopamine.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the number of months (999.9) during which an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar.  It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.:The period of time during which something continues.

Concepts.definition: One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.
The period of time during which something continues.
